it.unipi.dii.lsmsd.pokeMongo.javaFXextensions.buttons

Class PostButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.control.Control
            • javafx.scene.control.Labeled
              • javafx.scene.control.ButtonBase
                • javafx.scene.control.Button
                  • it.unipi.dii.lsmsd.pokeMongo.javaFXextensions.buttons.PostButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget, javafx.scene.control.Skinnable

    public class PostButton
extends javafx.scene.control.Button
    To use this class you have to create two object, one related to the answer and the other to the comment part. First you create the answer PostButton, then the comment one giving it as input. Done that, you have to let the answer PostButton to know which is the comment PostButton it has to interact with (setCommentButton)

        Parameters:
        text - what's should be written in it
        x - the x axis position
        y - the y axis potion
        subPostsVBox - the SubPostsVBox is related to
        currentPost - the current post this button is related to
        numberOfAnswers - the number of answers related to the post.

      • PostButton

        public PostButton(java.lang.String text,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  SubPostsVBox subPostsVBox,
                  Post currentPost,
                  int numberOfAnswers,
                  PostButton postButton)
        Parameters:
        text - what's should be written in it
        x - the x axis position
        y - the y axis potion
        subPostsVBox - the SubPostsVBox is related to
        currentPost - the current post this button is related to
        numberOfAnswers - the number of answers related to the post.
        postButton - a PostButton that refers to an Answer PostButton
